entries.meaning: A state of dependence; a refusal to exercise initiative.
examples: Frank's sullen dependency was driving his father nuts.

entries.meaning: Something dependent on, or subordinate to, something else:
examples: In the United States' governmental structure, the military is conceived as a dependency under the executive branch.

entries.meaning: A colony, or a territory subject to rule by an external power.
A dependence on a habit-forming substance such as a drug or alcohol.
(computing) Reliance on the functionality provided by some other, external component.
examples: This library has dependencies on a lot of other libraries. We have to compile all of those other libraries first.

entries.meaning: (computing) An external component whose functionality is relied on.
examples: One of this library's dependencies is very finicky. It can be hard to get it to compile on some systems.
